metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7447 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the EscapeParenthesis function inGraphicsMagick before 1.3.25 allows remote attackers to have unspecifiedimpact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7447` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1').
